result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J. Yehudah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph J. Yehudah is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph J. Yehudah was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  PD Denise Hertz-McGrath - TBD within 45 days.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

supervisions.notes: COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED.

superMiscConds.notes:
***JOC IS AMENDED DUE TO COURT COSTS WERE DUPLICATED IN ERROR***
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied  Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.

14CF272 - count 2 - deft sentenced to 671 days WSP concurrent to 14CF171.  Credit for 671 days.  Costs rolled into sentence.  Count 1 - deft fined $300 plus costs.  In default, 6 days KCJ concurrent to count 2.
